ngoList.address: M.S.NAIK FOUNDATION 2544,DR.AMBEDKAR MARG, DHANJI NAKA, RATNAGIRI -415612
ngoList.title: M S NAIK FOUNDATION
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: A grassroots development agency M S Naik Foundtion has been active in Ratnagiri District since 1985. Its work with marginalised communities, in rural and urban areas has a special focus on women. The Foundations involvement with Muslims has grown over the years, because of its observation of communitys low development indicators. M.S.Naik Foundation, founded by a professional social worker, believes education to be the key to development. It seeks to mainstream the Muslim community through its educational programmes and by helping them access government scholarships for needy students. Central to its vision of womens empowerment is economic development. Its future plans are to engage in agro-food processing as an income generation enterprise for women.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Major Activities & Vision To inspire people in learning Yoga Pranayam Dhyaan Sadhana and Siddha Meditation and spread the energy of Universal Peace, Compassion and Harmony in the entire universe. To educate the people of the world to respect each and every religion practiced and to observe tolerance towards every religious faith. To impart education in respect of Purification of Five Element through Bhutshuddhikriya, Gurukriya in academic institutes, private and public sector organizations, rural to urban centers via organizing education camps. To train and to appoint qualified teachers for teaching Bhutshuddhikriya and Gurukriya & other practices for Self Personality development. To assist needy people in their medical and education requirements. To train the youth of the nation and to inspire them towards patriotism, to teach the mankind about the essence of showing tolerance, respect, regard and reverence to all the religious faiths. It has been formed on the principle of Spiritual achievements. To encourage people on adopting the doctrine Sarva Dharma Samabhav and also Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam. The end goal of every single activity we do in life is to get eternal and infinite happiness. Nobody wants to experience suffering. Due to lack of proper knowledge of self, an individual chases the objects in the external world to find solution to lifes challenges that lies in physical, mental and emotional dimensions. This ignorance results in dissatisfaction, disappointment & frustration which eventually results in suffering that leads to disturbed families, divided societies and disintegrated nations. Path of Divine Lifes vision of One integrated world Family i.e. an integrated world of eternal infinite happy people, strongly bonded on human values and culture, is inspired by the mission towards universal development of human values of Peace, Unconditional love and Non violence through the revolutionary combination of Self Life Education, Value Education and Career oriented education systems. PDL approach is to awaken the intellect and evolve the consciousness of an individual who is the fundamental unit of the one integrated world Major Achievements Have trained 40000 people on Bhutshuddhikriya and Gurukriya across 14 states Have signed MoU with Adult Education Institute under the Presidential secretariat of Sri Lanka to impart the Self Development Education to officials of Govt. of Sri Lanka. 125 participants have visited till date in 2015 to India to attend the Personality and Productivity Development programs. Have conducted Life Management workshops in Sri Lanka, Nepal and Bhutan in collaboration with Indian Cultural Centers under Indian High Commission. Have presented papers on Bhutshuddhikriya and Siddha Krushi in symposium organized by SAARC Cultural Center. First of a kind education program on complex topics of Self Realization and Absolute Realization conducted in which 200 people participated and got the direction and purpose of life. Conducted a charity by sponsoring education for 5 students. Conducted personality coaching camps for Tribal and Transgender and trained them on teachings of Vedic Culture on how to improve quality of life.
